p: Methods for the detection of virus-specific antigens have allowed rapid identification of a wide variety of viruses (Table 3.1). Specific monoclonal antibodies conjugated to biochemical markers may provide high levels of sensitivity and specificity [ 13]. The key to the success of the assays outlined below is the use of reliable virus-specific antibody. Molecular biological techniques that permit the production of relatively large quantities of avid monoclonal antibodies have facilitated viral antigen detection.
